title: [aerospace] Frequent Minor Delays
description: The average delay minutes is 10.49, with a significant number of records falling into the 'MINIMAL' and 'MINOR' delay categories. This suggests operational inefficiencies.
recommendations: Implement process improvements to reduce delays
business_impact: Improving on-time performance can enhance customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

title: [aerospace] Concentration of Baggage Handling Operations
description: All baggage handling records originate from a single airport (ICN), indicating a potential over-reliance on this hub for baggage operations.
recommendations: Diversify baggage handling operations across multiple airports
Assess contingency plans for operational disruptions at ICN
business_impact: Mitigating risks associated with operational disruptions at a single airport can enhance resilience.

title: [aerospace] Employee Shift Pattern Imbalance
description: A significant majority of employees (50 out of 70) work on a rotational shift pattern, which may lead to employee fatigue and impact performance.
recommendations: Evaluate shift patterns for employee well-being
business_impact: Improving employee satisfaction can lead to better performance and reduced turnover.

title: [aerospace] Frequent Delays with Specific Carriers
description: The carrier KAL is responsible for the highest number of delays (17 records), indicating potential operational inefficiencies or issues with their flight schedules.
recommendations: Implement performance improvement plans for KAL
business_impact: Frequent delays can lead to customer dissatisfaction and financial losses.

title: [aerospace] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records show a single bag type (CHECKED) and a single scan status (SCANNED), indicating a lack of diversity in baggage handling processes which could lead to operational vulnerabilities.
recommendations: Implement additional bag types and statuses
business_impact: Lack of diversity can lead to inefficiencies and increased risk of operational failures.

title: [aerospace] Potential for Increased Passenger Compensation Due to Delays
description: The average passenger compensation related to delays is low (0.04), suggesting that passengers may not be adequately compensated for delays, which could lead to reputational damage.
recommendations: Review compensation policies for delayed flights
Enhance communication with passengers during delays
business_impact: Inadequate compensation can harm customer loyalty and brand reputation.
